data.title: McLaughlin, DDS, PLS
data.meta_description: What makes us different as a Fort Smith dentist? Dr. Brittany McLaughlin has been practicing dentistry since 2008, when she graduated from the University of ...
data.text:
Taylor Walker, RDH

Taylor was born and raised in Ozark, Arkansas, where she still resides and is now raising her own daughter. She attended the University of Arkansas-Fort Smith, where she graduated with her Bachelor’s Degree in Dental Hygiene.

In her free time she loves spending time with her daughter and family. She also enjoys doing arts and crafts, reading, and doing puzzles. She is very passionate about her job and loves working with Dr. McLaughlin and her co-workers.

Mayra Castillo, Front Office

Mayra, a Texas native, was brought to Arkansas to experience country life and leave the city behind. She has been in the dental and insurance field for eight years.

She has an eight-year-old daughter that loves basketball and softball. When she’s not at work, her daughter’s sports activities take center stage along with tending her chickens and garden. She has been married for ten years to a hard-working husband who supports her and fills her life with laughter.

With a knowledgeable and friendly disposition, she’s excited to welcome you into our office and eager to assist you with any insurance questions you may have.

Brittany Cunningham, RDA

Brittany was born and raised in the Fort Smith area, attending high school in Van Buren. She graduated from ATU in 2010 with an AAS in Business Technology, then became a chairside dental assistant in 2015.

Away from the dental office, Brittany has many hobbies including lifting, running, hiking, obstacle course racing, and anything involving the outdoors and physical activity. She enjoys spending all her free time making memories with her daughter, Rylee.

Pam Wann, RDA

Pam grew up in southeast Oklahoma. She originally applied for a front office position in a dental office in 1996, but was offered a position as a chairside assistant instead. She has loved helping people improve their smile and overall health ever since. Pam joined this office in 2020.

She and her husband, Roger, share five adult children and ten grandchildren. In her free time, she enjoys reading, hiking, traveling, fishing at Broken Bow Lake, and spending time with her family.

Annabel Moses, Front Office

Annabel has had a diverse life, from her birthplace in Fort Smith to her upbringing in Dora, Oklahoma, to being stationed in Hawaii and later working in Washington state as a dental receptionist. Additionally, she took online assisting courses through a Kentucky program, which was made possible by her MYCAA grant. She returned home after her husband completed his military service, reuniting with their family.

She prioritizes fitness, family, and friends and always stays active. When she’s not binge-watching Netflix and snacking, she’s out in nature, seeking new experiences and making memories.
